name: LinkPure
description: A cross-platform application that monitors clipboard URL changes and rewrites them based on user-defined rules.
readme_summary: LinkPure is a cross-platform application designed to automatically rewrite URLs copied to the clipboard based on user-defined rules. It offers a visual interface for rule management, includes over 1000 pre-configured rules for cleaning tracking parameters and unwrapping redirects, and provides system notifications for rewritten URLs.
primary_use_case: Automatically cleaning and simplifying URLs copied to the clipboard by removing tracking parameters and unwrapping redirect links.
cover_image_prompt: A magical scribe sitting at a desk, holding a quill that glows with digital energy. The scribe is actively transforming messy, tangled strings of text (representing cluttered URLs) into clean, elegant ribbons of light. Input URLs are shown as chaotic scribbles on one side of the desk, while the output URLs are represented by perfectly formed, glowing symbols on the other. Subtle UI elements resembling a rule management interface are visible on a nearby floating screen, with small data particles flowing between the scribe's quill and the screen. The scene is set in a cozy, modern study with warm, inviting lighting. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, friendly aesthetic and a vibrant color palette.

name: WebDeck
readme_summary: WebDeck is a free, open-source alternative to physical Stream Decks. It's a Flask web application that allows users to control their computer remotely via any browser-enabled device with a touchscreen, offering a customizable interface for shortcuts and commands.
key_features: Flask web application for remote computer control
Browser-based interface accessible from any device
Free alternative to physical Stream Deck hardware
primary_use_case: To provide a software-based, customizable remote control interface for computers, acting as a free alternative to dedicated hardware like the Elgato Stream Deck.
cover_image_prompt: A 3D isometric illustration of a user's hand holding a tablet, which displays a vibrant, customizable grid of buttons. Each button on the tablet is visually linked by glowing digital streams to corresponding icons on a computer screen in the background, representing actions like launching applications or controlling media. The scene is set in a modern, clean workspace with soft, ambient lighting. Subtle UI elements and data particles flow between the tablet and the computer, emphasizing the remote control and web-based nature of WebDeck. The overall mood is one of seamless connectivity and user empowerment.

name: gomlx
description: GoMLX: An Accelerated Machine Learning Framework For Go
readme_summary: GoMLX is an accelerated machine learning and generic math framework for Go, designed to be a PyTorch/Jax/TensorFlow equivalent for the Go ecosystem. It supports a pure Go backend for broad compatibility and an optimized backend using OpenXLA for high-performance computation on CPUs, GPUs, and TPUs, including distributed training.
key_features: Pure Go backend (runs everywhere Go runs, including WASM)
Optimized backend with OpenXLA (CPU, GPU, TPU support)
Easy to extend and experiment with new ideas
primary_use_case: Developing and training machine learning models in Go with high performance and broad hardware acceleration.
cover_image_prompt: A Go Gopher character, acting as a skilled artisan, is meticulously crafting intricate gears and circuits from raw, glowing data streams. These streams represent complex mathematical formulas and neural network structures. The Gopher uses a specialized GoMLX toolkit, subtly integrated into the scene, to shape and assemble these components. On one side, raw data inputs are visible as rough stones; on the other, polished, functional ML models are emerging, ready to be deployed. The background is a clean, modern workshop with subtle digital interfaces displaying progress and metrics. The overall style is a vibrant 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing precision and innovation.

name: resterm
description: Terminal client for HTTP/GraphQL/gRPC with support for SSH tunnels, WebSockets, SSE, workflows, profiling, OpenAPI and response diffs.
readme_summary: Resterm is a powerful terminal-based client designed for interacting with various network protocols including HTTP, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSockets, and SSE. It emphasizes a keyboard-driven workflow and local data storage, offering features like SSH tunnels, OAuth 2.0 support, and a custom scripting language for complex request logic.
key_features: Terminal-based client for HTTP, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSocket, SSE
OAuth 2.0 support (client credentials, password grant, authorization code + PKCE)
RestermScript (RTS) for scripting, templates, and workflows
Timeline tracing and profiler for debugging
primary_use_case: A terminal-native client for developers to efficiently test, debug, and interact with various network APIs and protocols without leaving their keyboard.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan in a dimly lit, cozy workshop, meticulously crafting intricate clockwork mechanisms. Each gear and spring represents a different network protocol (HTTP, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSocket, SSE). The artisan uses specialized, glowing tools to assemble these components, with lines of light connecting them to a central, complex device. Small, subtle UI elements resembling terminal windows and code snippets are integrated into the workshop's background. The overall mood is one of focused creation and technical mastery, with a warm, inviting color palette. The style should be a detailed 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing the precision and interconnectedness of the components.

name: gojekyll
description: A fast Go implementation of the Jekyll blogging engine
readme_summary: Gojekyll is a Go-based implementation of the Jekyll static site generator, offering faster build times and live reloading. It aims for partial compatibility with Jekyll, supporting Liquid templating and Sass, and provides `build` and `serve` commands.
key_features: Fast static site generation (approx. 20x faster than Jekyll)
Live reload and directory watch for `serve` command
primary_use_case: Building and serving static websites with a focus on speed and developer experience, as an alternative to Jekyll.
cover_image_prompt: A swift, sleek, metallic hummingbird, intricately designed with subtle Go programming language motifs, is rapidly assembling a beautiful, vibrant website from scattered digital components. The hummingbird hovers over a workbench where digital bricks labeled 'content' and 'templates' are being precisely placed. Glowing lines of code emanate from its wings, forming the structure of a clean, modern website displayed on a nearby screen. The background is a stylized, minimalist workshop with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing speed and efficiency. The Gojekyll logo is subtly integrated into the hummingbird's design. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, modern aesthetic and a vibrant color palette.
